solution_line_template: The Ferris wheel will be open for {end_time_hour} - {start_time_hour} = {open_hours} hours.

In one hour the wheel can ride {minutes_per_hour} minutes / {ride_duration_minutes} minutes = <<{minutes_per_hour}/{ride_duration_minutes}={rides_per_hour}>>{rides_per_hour} times the number of riders.
The total per hour riders is {rides_per_hour} * {capacity_per_ride} people = <<{rides_per_hour}*{capacity_per_ride}={people_per_hour}>>{people_per_hour} people.
If the ride is open {open_hours} hours * {people_per_hour} people = <<{open_hours}*{people_per_hour}={total_people_can_ride}>>{total_people_can_ride} people can ride.
